question:
Which of the following were the most prominent ports on the eastern coast of India during Sangam period?
1. Tamralipti  
2. Arikamedu 
3. Kalyana
Select the correct option from the codes given below:
explanation: Some of the prominent ports on the eastern coast of India during the Sangam age were Tamralipti in West Bengal and Arikamedu  in Tamil Nadu Coast. Kalyana was on the western coast.
